word: Let those who select the missionaries make close investigation and see if they have consecrated themselves body, soul and spirit to God, to preserve their powers for the work that is suffering to be done. Men and women who have not settled purpose, who are not consecrated to the work, should not be sent at great expense to labor in other fields.--Ms 152, 1899, p. 1. ("The Temple of God Must Be Holy," typed October 31, 1899.)
